javadoc:
The Ghidra test application layout defines the customizable elements of the Ghidra application's directory structure when running a test.

This layout exists because tests often need to provide their own user settings directory, rather than using Ghidra's default.

methods.name: <init>
methods.comment:
Constructs a new Ghidra application layout object with the provided user settings
 directory.
 
 This layout is useful when running Ghidra tests.

params.name: userSettingsDir
params.comment: The custom user settings directory to use.

throws.comment: if there was a problem getting a user directory.
if there was a problem getting the application properties.

name: GhidraTestApplicationLayout
comment:
The Ghidra test application layout defines the customizable elements of the Ghidra 
 application's directory structure when running a test.
 
 This layout exists because tests often need to provide their own user settings
 directory, rather than using Ghidra's default.
